lines.text: There is a time to laugh and a time not to laugh, and this is not one of them.
My face! You've stolen my face! Give me back my face, you fiend!
I think it only fair to say that your being brought in on this case was not my idea.
You are too modest.
Yes, well, life is not all shoot-shoot, bang-bang, you know.

[clutching a bottle of wine just ruined by Clouseau]
I've nursed this bottle since Dunkirk.
Could you give us a statement please?
Yes. Chocolate makes one very thirsty.
I ruin everything I touch.
Hey, what's the matter with you?

[close to tears]
Arrested twice, I destroy a phone booth at a railroad station... I steal from a nun, I don't know my own face. A man comes up to me with, with my own face tied on, I don't recognize who it is. I don't... I don't deserve to have this autographed picture of Sean Connery!
[takes a picture from back pocket and tears it apart]
You must trust no one. The viper in our bosom could be anyone.
I suspect everyone!
You will report only to me.
And what makes you think I trust you?
I don't deserve to have this autographed picture of Sean Connery!
I shall let that pass, since you cannot possibly know whose leg it is that you are pushing.
Do you know something about machinery?
I don't know something about machinery, I know everything about machinery.

[to Clouseau]
I love the way you eat... like a jungle animal.
Hey, what about the crooks?
The crooks never sleep and neither does Clouseau.

[on police radio]
That's our final report. Over and out.
Roger and goodbye.

[shouting]
You'll soon be laughing at the other side of my face, my friend!

[parachuting out of a plane]
Kurosawa!
And now since we are becoming so chummy, perhaps you can tell me about the Great Train Robbery.
I don't know nothing!
He who don't know nothing, must know something, eh?
The crooks never sleep and neither does Closeeau!
Anonymity is a virtue. Every fool knows that. Anonymity's next to cleanliness and I don't have to tell you what that's next to.
